pullRequest.body:
Refactors `yonedaLemma`. Also dualizes all definitions and results related to `yonedaLemma` to obtain `coyonedaLemma` and friends.

---

nodes.body: @joelriou I adapted the `yoneda` part accordingly. Note that I kept both `yonedaEquiv_naturality` versions, since, in contrary to the `coyoneda` case, the one with no `op`s on the LHS is not in simp NF.

Thanks so much for the effort!

bors d+

Seems like a straightforward "dualisation". LGTM
Seems like a straightforward "dualisation". LGTM
Do we want it as a `simp` lemma then? Removing the attribute doesn't break anything in the rest of the file.
I think that this equivalence should be defined first, and everything else should be deduced from it. (The same refactor should be done also for `yonedaEquiv`.)

Are you saying that `coyonedaLemma` should become:
```lean
def coyonedaLemma : coyonedaPairing C ≅ coyonedaEvaluation C where
  hom := {
      app := fun (X, F) x ↦ ULift.up (coyonedaEquiv x)
      naturality := by
        intro (X, F) (Y, G) f
        ext a
        simp [coyonedaEvaluation, ← FunctorToTypes.naturality, coyonedaEquiv]
    }
  inv := {
      app := fun (X, F) x ↦ coyonedaEquiv.symm x.down
      naturality := by
        intro X Y f
        ext a b c
        simp [← FunctorToTypes.naturality, coyonedaEquiv]
    }
  hom_inv_id := by
    ext
    simp
  inv_hom_id := by
    ext
    simp
    rfl
```
where `coyonedaEquiv` is moved up (and changed to take `X : C` instead of `X : Cᵒᵖ`, since this has better definitional properties (gets rid of some `erw`s).

Yes, mostly, though a more direct definition can be obtained as follows:
```lean
def coyonedaEquiv {X : Cᵒᵖ} {F : C ⥤ Type v₁} : (coyoneda.obj X ⟶ F) ≃ F.obj X.unop where
  toFun φ := φ.app _ (𝟙 _)
  invFun := sorry
  left_inv := sorry
  right_inv := sorry

def coyonedaLemma : coyonedaPairing C ≅ coyonedaEvaluation C :=
  NatIso.ofComponents (fun X => Equiv.toIso (coyonedaEquiv.trans Equiv.ulift.symm)) sorry
```

Please check the latest commit to see if this is what you wanted. In the proof of `coyonedaLemma` appear two `erw`s which I don't understand. I tried to debug with `pp.explicit` but did not find why the lemma does not apply with `rw` alone.
I am not worried about the two `erw`. It seems it is related to issues with coercions to functions (which cause a lot of similar problems, and I am qualified to know how this could be fixed...).
If you are happy with the `co`-part, I'll adjust the non-`co` part accordingly.
Apart from the question of the fate of `coyonedaSections*`, it looks good to me! (I am sorry that while proceeding to this PR, you did not expect that I would trick you into doing a refactor!)

I think that the right statement is your `coyonedaEquiv_naturality'` and that `coyoneda_naturality` can be removed. (The idea is that in `coyonedaEquiv_naturality`, there are no `op` or `unop` of morphisms in the LHS.)
I think that this `coyonedaEquiv_comp'` can be removed.
I think `coyonedaEquiv_comp` should be removed instead, since `coyonedaEquiv_comp'` is the one in simp NF.
Correct!

The definition and the next one does not need `ulift`, so that I believe it should be defined directly as:
```lean
/-- The curried version of coyoneda lemma when `C` is small. -/
def curriedCoyonedaLemma {C : Type u₁} [SmallCategory C] :
    (coyoneda.rightOp ⋙ coyoneda : C ⥤ (C ⥤ Type u₁) ⥤ Type u₁) ≅ evaluation C (Type u₁) :=
  NatIso.ofComponents (fun X =>
    NatIso.ofComponents (fun F => Equiv.toIso coyonedaEquiv)) (by sorry)

/-- The curried version of coyoneda lemma when `C` is small. -/
def curriedCoyonedaLemma' {C : Type u₁} [SmallCategory C] :
    yoneda ⋙ (whiskeringLeft C (C ⥤ Type u₁)ᵒᵖ (Type u₁)).obj coyoneda.rightOp ≅
      𝟭 (C ⥤ Type u₁) :=
  NatIso.ofComponents (fun F => NatIso.ofComponents (fun X => Equiv.toIso coyonedaEquiv) sorry)
```
(By extending `Functor.flip` to make it a functor which sends a functor to its flip, it should be possible to define the second curried iso from the first, but I am not sure there is a strong need from this API for bifunctors.)

If seems that this definition can be removed. Could you try to get rid of  `coyonedaSections` as well? (Currently, it is certainly unused! But, for the other, as this is a direct application of `yonedaLemma`, it should be possible to change the downstream uses of it so that it refers directly to the (refactored) `yonedaLemma`.)
I removed them.

I guess that we could remove this line now:
```suggestion
```
